attributes.action: Discard all petitions requesting a 2nd referendum. Accept Brexit!
attributes.additional_details:
EU Referendum Rules triggering a 2nd EU Referendum - How many referendums will Bremain ask for? The answer is "However many it takes until they win!".

Regardless of how many people sign this petition, the fact is that leave won the referendum by a difference of 1,269, 501 votes. 17,410,742 voted to leave the EU, and this decision must be final & respected. 

We wouldn't be allowed to have a 2nd general election because we were unhappy that the conservatives were elected. 

The result is final.
attributes.background: The majority of the British Public has voted to Brexit from the European Union. If Bremain had won the vote, David Cameron would have ensured Brexit supporters were made to accept the result (something he said before the referendum). The same works both ways. There must be no second referendum.
